com.apriori.concurrent

Interface InterceptingExecutorService.Decorator

  • Enclosing class:
    InterceptingExecutorService

    public static interface InterceptingExecutorService.Decorator
    A decorator, that can perform actions before and after each task.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  InterceptingExecutorService.Decorator.Builder
      Builds a decorator, composing up to three functional interfaces.

    • Method Detail

      • beforeStart

        default void beforeStart(ExecutorService delegate,
                         Callable<?> task)
        Performs actions before the given task. Implementations should not call task.call().
        Parameters:
        delegate - the underlying executor that is executing the task
        task - the task that is running

      • afterFinish

        default <T> void afterFinish(ExecutorService delegate,
                             Callable<T> task,
                             T result)
        Performs actions after the given task has completed successfully.
        Parameters:
        delegate - the underlying executor that is executing the task
        task - the task that ran
        result - the result produced by the task

      • afterFailed

        default void afterFailed(ExecutorService delegate,
                         Callable<?> task,
                         Throwable cause)
        Performs actions after the given task has failed.
        Parameters:
        delegate - the underlying executor that is executing the task
        task - the task that failed
        cause - the cause of failure

      • builder

        static InterceptingExecutorService.Decorator.Builder builder()
        Returns a new builder, for creating a decorator from simple lambda expressions.
        Returns:
        a new builder

      • asInterceptor

        static InterceptingExecutorService.Interceptor asInterceptor(List<? extends InterceptingExecutorService.Decorator> decorators)
        Converts a list of decorators into a single interceptor. The interceptor invokes each decorator before the task, in the order they appear in the list. After the task, the decorators are invoked in the opposite order.

        Execution of the task is short-circuited if a decorator throws an exception from its beforeStart(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService, java.util.concurrent.Callable<?>) action. In such an event, subsequent decorators are skipped. For every invocation of beforeStart(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService, java.util.concurrent.Callable<?>), either afterFinish(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService, java.util.concurrent.Callable<T>, T) or afterFailed(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService, java.util.concurrent.Callable<?>, java.lang.Throwable) will be invoked. So, if a decorator throws an exception, short-circuiting task execution, any decorators already invoked will have their afterFailed(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService, java.util.concurrent.Callable<?>, java.lang.Throwable) action invoked.

        Parameters:
        decorators - a list of decorators
        Returns:
        an interceptor that invokes the given decorators
